meanings.definition: A person or company that forwards or sends goods or messages to another destination.
meanings.sent1: The forwarders delivered the package to the customer's house.
meanings.sent2: The forwarders at the post office help send letters to different cities.
meanings.sent3: The forwarders accidentally sent the package to the wrong address, causing a mix-up.
meanings.sent4: She was like a forwarder of happiness, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The forwarders swiftly transported the goods across the country.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that moves something forward.
meanings.sent1: The conveyor belt acted as a forwarder, pushing the boxes along.
meanings.sent2: The forwarders in the factory helped streamline the production process.
meanings.sent3: The little robot was a cute forwarder, nudging the ball forward with each push.
meanings.sent4: The escalator was a silent forwarder, carrying people effortlessly to the next floor.
meanings.sent5: The forwarders in the engine propelled the train forward with great force.

meanings.definition: A person who advocates or promotes a cause or idea.
meanings.sent1: The forwarders of environmental protection campaigns work tirelessly to raise awareness.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a forwarder of equality, fighting for justice for all.
meanings.sent3: The forwarders of the new policy faced opposition but stood firm in their beliefs.
meanings.sent4: He was a forwarder of peace, always seeking diplomatic solutions to conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The forwarders of education initiatives strive to provide learning opportunities for all.
